msContents.summary: “Two receipts for poll-taxes of the twelfth(?) year in the amphodon Hieras Pules paid apparently by the same person through Diodorus, the first payment being 8 drachmae with [4] obols for prosdiagraphomena, the second for 12 drachmae with 6 obols for prosdiagraphomena. The second receipt is dated in the 13th(?) year of Hadrian (AD 128-9); the date of the first is lost, but was probably the same. Incomplete.” (Grenfell, Hunt, and Hogarth)

msItemStruct.note: Text is on one side only, 10 lines with the fibers. Text is in two columns, each a separate receipt that can most likely be dated within the same year. Second column most likely in a separate hand, as writing appears more compact and darker than first hand. Bottom margin is clearly visible, other margins are torn.
Museum of Archaelogy and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 21.2 x 9.3cm. Torn on all margins. Large lacunae throughout text, especially left column.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1898-9) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).
